content: Initializes a new HeroUI project using official templates. Options include `--template` (or `-t`) to specify a framework template (e.g., 'app', 'vite') and `--package` (or `-p`) for the package manager.

Adds HeroUI components to your project, automatically managing dependencies and Tailwind configuration. Can be run interactively to select components or by specifying component names. Use `--all` to add all components.
Upgrades HeroUI components to the latest version. Use `--all` to upgrade all components at once, or specify component names. The `--write` flag saves changes to `package.json`.
Removes HeroUI components from your project, cleaning up dependencies and configuration. Can be run with component names or with `--all`.
Lists all currently installed HeroUI components in the project. Use the `--remote` (or `-r`) flag to see all components available for installation.
Diagnoses the project for common issues like redundant dependencies, missing configurations in `tailwind.config.js`, or incorrect `pnpm` setup.
Displays debug information about the local environment, including installed components and their versions, OS, and Node version.
